articles.author: Andrew Goudsward, Sarah N. Lynch
articles.description: Donald Trump was hit by a new federal indictment on Tuesday in his bid to overturn his 2020 election defeat, with prosecutors narrowing their approach after a U.S. Supreme Court ruling that former presidents have broad immunity form criminal prosecution.
articles.title: Donald Trump faces revised US indictment in election subversion case

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Tuesday that the war with Russia would eventually end in dialogue, but that Kyiv had to be in a strong position and that he would present a plan to U.S. President Joe Biden and his two potential successors.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy to present plan to Biden to end war with Russia

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Palestinians displaced by fighting in the Gaza Strip crowded onto the seashore as Israeli forces continued to battle Hamas fighters in central and southern areas, with health officials reporting at least 17 people killed in strikes on Tuesday.
articles.title: Israel battles Hamas in Gaza as space for displaced families narrows

articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: Donald Trump's advantage over Kamala Harris on the economy and crime is eroding among U.S. voters, a sign the Democratic vice president's campaign is gathering momentum ahead of the Nov. 5 presidential election, according to a new Reuters/Ipsos poll.
articles.title: Trump's edge over Harris on economy, crime slips, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian drones set oil tanks on fire at an depot in Russia's Rostov region, Russian Telegram channels reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: Ukraine drones set oil depot ablaze in Russia's Rostov region, Telegram channels say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Social media platform X experienced outages late on Tuesday, with over 36,500 reports in the U.S. at the peak of the outage, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.
articles.title: Social media platform X down for thousands of users globally, Downdetector shows

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden's national security adviser Jake Sullivan started his second day of meetings with top Chinese officials in Beijing on Wednesday, aimed at quieting tensions between the two superpowers ahead of the Nov. 5 U.S. election.
articles.title: China holds 2nd day of talks on Taiwan, fentanyl with top Biden aide

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Protesters blocked train tracks, stopped buses and shouted slogans in the eastern Indian state of West Bengal on Wednesday, the latest in a series of protests that have rocked the state since the rape and murder of a trainee doctor.
articles.title: Protesters block train tracks, buses in eastern India

articles.author: Kirsty Needham, Lewis Jackson
articles.description: Leaders of several Pacific Islands said on Wednesday they have endorsed an Australian-funded A$400 million ($271 million) plan to improve police training and create a mobile regional policing unit, as Canberra looks to reduce China's security footprint in the area.
articles.title: Pacific Islands endorse $271 mln regional policing plan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan on Wednesday braced for Typhoon Shanshan, with heavy rain and strong winds forecast, forcing airlines and railways to cancel some services over the coming days.
articles.title: Japan braces for Typhoon Shanshan, heavy rain and strong winds forecast
